name: Cough
description: Cough is a reflex action that helps clear mucus, irritants, or infections from the airways. Most coughs are caused by viral infections and improve within 1–2 weeks.

mild.definition: Short-duration mild cough without danger signs

high_risk.definition: Severe cough or cough with respiratory danger signs

criteria.other_symptoms: breathing difficulty, chest pain, blood in phlegm

self_care: Drink warm fluids to soothe the throat
Use steam inhalation to ease congestion
Avoid cold drinks and irritants like smoke
Use honey (for adults) to relieve throat irritation

medicines.name: Dextromethorphan 15mg Syrup
avoid_if: Chronic lung disease without medical advice
medicines.dose: Adults: 10–20 mg every 4 hours or 30 mg every 6–8 hours (Max 120 mg/day)

medicines.name: Guaifenesin 200mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Relief of productive cough with mucus
avoid_if: Persistent cough lasting more than 2 weeks

doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if cough persists beyond two weeks or is associated with breathing difficulty, chest pain, or blood in phlegm.

assessment_questions.question: What type of cough do you have?
How many days have you had this cough?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek medical care for severe or persistent cough.
